comments:
Eclipse 200303062359
RH 8.0

See also bug #34128 for slightly different setup.

Launch eclipse with a new workspace.
Turn off automatic compile
From CVS load platform-core, platform-ui, platform-ui-examples, org.eclipse.swt
and org.eclipse.swt.gtk
Copy the .classpath_gtk in org.eclipse.swt to .classpath.
Import all required plug-ins as source
Import org.eclipse.apache as binary (you can't bring this in as source due to
another bug).

At no time was I prompted as I was in bug #34128 to alter classpaths etc.
Now turn on compile.

Everything compiles.
Now launch a debug session.

The following log is generated:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 120 Mar 07, 2003 13:50:35.685
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug UI:
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Launching failed. Required Library
"startup.jar" is missing from the target platform.
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.createWorkspaceRunnerConfiguration(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDeleg
ate.java:162)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:74)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:152)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:672)
        at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools.buildAndLaunch(DebugUITools.java:537)
        at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$2.run(DebugUITools.java:486)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:95)

What am I missing?
I tried setting the non-workspace plug-ins via the PDE preference page target
platform, selecting all, but that made no difference.

Followed all the steps verbatim using I-20030307 and was able to launch without
any problems.

Agree, I was just updating the text myself.  This might have been related to a 
CVS bug that was fixed between 200303062369 and 200303071024

Another interesting bug that was fixed as a result of the CVS corruption is bug 
#34137 in which motif would not launch debug due to a corrupt .gif file.  
The .gif file was missing one byte, the line-feed.

Sorry about that.  I will now go verify bug #34128

traces.message: Launching failed. Required Library "startup.jar" is missing from the target platform.
